info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 9:21AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Elbert, southeastern Hart, south central Anderson and southwestern Abbeville Counties through 1000 AM EDT... At 921 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Elberton, or near Nancy Hart State Park, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elberton, Iva, Lake Secession, Starr, Lowndesville, Russell State Park, Nancy Hart State Park, Middleton, Lake Russell and Fortsonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
